item.title: Dependency scanning tools as a solution to a different problem
item.description: Since dependency vulnerability scanning has been suggested by colleagues as something that could help with security/standards compliance and addressing legacy software, I’ve been looking into a few services to see how useful the available options could be. NPM Audit Dependency scanning is performed by default with the install command for later versions of NPM, and by default, the output of npm audit will show a few lines of relevant information about each package with a reported vulnerability - its rating, a brief description of the vulnerability and whether an update is available.
